Subject: Re: font selection interface
From: Jungshik Shin <jshin@pantheon.yale.edu>
Newsgroups: netscape.public.mozilla.i18n

In <38D96698.1E2E3B7C@netscape.com>, Erik van der Poel wrote:
: Jungshik Shin wrote:

:> :   http://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=27378
:> 
:>   Thanks for letting me know about this. I've added
:> a comment that font encoding also needs to be specified.

  Another feature desirable is let users specify multiple fonts
(as opposed to a single font) for a given language/scripts/Unicode ranges
and a given style(?). 

   Korean Hangul : UAC00-UDxxx : 
         Serif :   font11,font12,font13
        SansSerif: font21,font22
         fixed : font31, font32, font33

   CJK ideograms : U4e00-      :
         Serif : font41, font 42
       SanSerif : font51,font52

This is useful when font11 doesn't have all the glyphs to cover a given
language/scripts/unicode range while font12 or font13 has some glyphs to
fill the gap but font12 and font13 are not so pretty as font11. That way,
users can have some fall-back mechanism.
summary: add font-list support  to the font pref front end
